body:
fixes #25734 

The system Python interpreter on `rhel` is patched to have slightly different names for some architectures. This makes it incompatible with manylinux generated extensions for `ppc64le`.

To fix this issue when bootstrapping Spack we generate on-the-fly symbolic links to the name expected by the current interpreter if different from the default expectation of CPython.

Links:
-  https://github.com/pypa/manylinux/issues/687
- https://src.fedoraproject.org/fork/churchyard/rpms/python3/blame/00274-fix-arch-names.patch?identifier=test_email-mktime
title: Fix clingo bootstrapping on rhel + ppc64le
